text:
:mega: *Attention HubSpot CRM Developers* :bell::sprocket-dance:

We need your help determining the future of the Projects framework!

We are embarking on an exciting new research study focused on file structure and configuration of projects and private apps on the HubSpot platform. :file_folder::mag:

If you love diving deep into the intricacies of development and want to help shape the future of HubSpot projects, this is the opportunity for you! :globe_with_meridians::hammer_and_wrench:

Interested? Let's collaborate and make a difference together! :handshake::speech_balloon: Please fill out <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdU__6ZvHd6pEvfULT6ejWVg-EpV1heg4j8_M8alH_yh10anQ/viewform|this questionnaire> if you’d like to participate

:rocket: *[Log Tracing for UI Extensions in Public Beta]*

Hi all - it's official! We've just launched the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/log-tracing-for-ui-extension-development|Log Tracing feature> for UI extensions with private apps. Customers can now connect all front-end React logs and back-end serverless function logs with a single Trace ID and view the full log trace in the '*Log Traces'* tab in the CRM Development page. We've also added the *'Extensions'* and '*Serverless functions'* tabs for customers to view comprehensive React and serverless log statements, copy the Trace ID, and open the relevant log trace. Please refer to the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/log-tracing-for-ui-extension-development|Changelog announcement> to learn more.

We'll continue to provide more impactful observability features for customers, so please stay tuned!

*Changelog announcement:* <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/log-tracing-for-ui-extension-development>

Is there any way to not show the Card completely when certain conditions are not met?
Right now my user can see this:
<@U021CFGT73K> we've talked about this before right? Having the ability in the record page customizer to add conditions for showing cards

yes we’re considering conditional display based on a property value for next year (currently it’s only by team). <@U02DYFPJH4J> could you describe what conditions you would set for the display logic? is it based on property, pipeline, etc?
yea, it's set on whether a certain properties: pipline, referentie_nummer (custom), referentie_type (custom). When they are all set, then show the actual UI, if not, don't show anything at all.
got it, so it would be based on multiple property values. thanks for clarifying! confirming this is not currently possible but something we plan to work on next year

Thanks for the feedback <@U02DYFPJH4J>! This is something my team is planning for next year. One thing I wanted to clarify:

This is currently possible on the left sidebar; you can set a card to display only if certain property conditions are met. However, it’s limited to just one property. In the screenshot below, my ‘BDR’ section will only show if the Lifecycle stage is Lead, Subscriber, or Marketing Qualified Lead.

Is this how you would think about your card? Would 1 property suffice, or would you need multiple properties/conditions?

Thanks in advance for the input!

NEW Components alert:stable_parrot::sprocket-dance::mega:
1. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components#dropdown|Dropdown component> to bundle multiple menu items / actions (see GIF below) 
2. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components#toggle|Toggle button> added (see image below) 
3. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components#dropdown|String truncation> added to <Text>
4. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extension-components#button|Multiple Button sizes> now available!
Also - an update to those who enrolled in the *Panels alpha* and have sent me your portal IDs, you should have received an email with instructions. Please reach out if you haven't received the info yet. Looking forward to seeing what you all create :slightly_smiling_face:

Is there a way to rename a CRM development project or is this considered bad practice? It seems like the only way to completely rename a project is to essentially delete and create a new project, and I was under the impression that It'd work similar to how renaming a repo works in GitHub (not that I know how GitHub achieves this :sweat_smile:)
